note: Said politely in various contexts, for example when attempting to get someone's attention
Used to give a positive answer or reply to a question, request, or offer; used to give an affirmative response.
Used to give a negative response; the opposite of yes.
A person attached to another by feelings of affection or personal bond.
Not fast; moving, flowing, or proceeding without speed or at less than usual speed.
A material made from fibers and in the form of thin sheets or a sheet or piece of such material.
An institution for educating children; any institution at which instruction is given in a particular discipline.
The thing that is measured as seconds, minutes, hours, days, etc.
A form of play or sport, especially a competitive one played according to rules and decided by skill, strength, or luck.
Making it easier or possible for someone to do something by offering them one's services or resources.
A solid or hollow spherical object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game.
An arc of colors that appears in the sky and is caused by the sun shining through rain, mist, or spray.
When you move forward by putting one foot in front of the other in a regular way.
